actions.text: Amendment SA 6569, under the order of 12/22/22, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 40 - 57. Record Vote Number: 415.
Amendment SA 6569 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Braun to Amendment SA 6558. (consideration: CR S10070; text: CR S10062) To eliminate a waiver of State immunity.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 6569 proposed by Senator Schumer for Senator Braun to Amendment SA 6558.

Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 6569, under the order of 12/22/22, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 40 - 57. Record Vote Number: 415.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 6569, under the order of 12/22/22, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 40 - 57. Record Vote Number: 415.

amends_amendment.purpose: To eliminate discrimination and promote women's health and economic security by ensuring reasonable workplace accommodations for workers whose ability to perform the functions of a job are limited by pregnancy, childbirth, or a related medical condition.

purpose: To eliminate a waiver of State immunity.
